我在耶路撒冷一家叫库里约的初创公司工作。那时候我有一个很好的习惯：我早上6点左右起床，和我的朋友去健身房，回到我的房间洗个澡，吃一碗沙拉，然后去上班。我早上9点左右上班，5点左右离开去见朋友，出去玩，或者做我那天晚上计划的任何活动。
同年9月，我第一次出国旅行。我和高中时最好的朋友去意大利旅行了两周。就像他们说的，我染上了旅行狂热。在那次旅行之后，我满脑子想的都是计划下一次飞行，以及什么时候我可以再次飞行。从那以后，我开始每月旅行。
有一天，我发现了一篇关于数字游牧民和远程工作的博客文章。就是这样，这就是我想要的！&#34；我对自己说，比赛开始琢磨我怎么才能做到这一点。几个月后，我在Toptal找到了我的第一份远程工作，并报名参加了为期3个月的环游东南亚(海上)之旅。2016年9月，也就是我第一次旅行一年后，我在泰国远程工作，享受海滩，喝着新鲜的椰子水，称自己为数字游牧民族。
努力工作，更努力玩耍：这是数字游牧民族的口号。每天的日程安排看起来都与前一天不同，这取决于我想做什么，或者我所在的团队正在计划什么。换句话说，不可能有固定的日程安排，你必须灵活多变。否则，你将不得不在“信息自由法”和“做一件糟糕的工作”之间做出选择，这样你就不会错过别人正在享受的乐趣。
出海3个月后，是时候回耶路撒冷看望家人并计划下一步行动了。我对回去并不兴奋，我在耶路撒冷长大，在那之前，我在那里度过了我的一生。在经历了这一切之后，我的生活变得如此艰难和无聊，我刚刚在天堂度过了3个月才回来。
突然之间，不再有海滩，不再有派对，也不再有可以一起闲逛的陌生人。有很多空闲时间，我不知道该怎么做。我每天所做的就是离开父母的家，去我花了五年时间获得计算机工程学位的大学校园，工作到很难睁开眼睛。
我把我所有的空闲时间都用来工作了。我和一个朋友创建了一家外包网络开发公司，一周7天每天工作14小时，我成了一个工作狂。我希望通过创建一家成功的企业，我将有办法逃离我的城市，搬到其他地方，回到我短暂的天堂生活。
在经历了3个月漫长的白天和不眠之夜的混乱之后，我意识到这不是我想要的。当然，我仍然想建立自己的企业，但我不喜欢我所走的道路。有一天，我发现自己在写这样的话：
我醒得很晚，像往常一样，试着睁开我疲惫的眼皮。我跳过了通常的问题“今天的计划是什么？”然后离开了我的床。自从我上一次回答这个问题已经将近3个月了，在我回到耶路撒冷的第一个星期之后，那是反复重复的同一天。起床，去大学校园，遇到同样的人，工作12-14个小时。
那天一切都一样，只有一件事例外，一个人想。突然，我发现自己大声地对自己喊道：“哦，妈的，我不高兴，操！”过了一会儿，我脑海里有个声音问道：“你幸福吗？”答案显然是否定的。我刚刚意识到我处于自动驾驶状态，忘了问自己一个如此琐碎的问题。“如果你不开心，那又有什么意义呢？”今天剩下的时间我一直在问自己。
工作只是我逃避现实，打发空闲时间的一种方式。这一切让我不禁要问：我现在是不是必须埋头工作，过着悲惨的生活，这样我未来的自己才能幸福呢？
也许你们中的许多人会说“是”，或者在说“不”之前会犹豫一下。但这并不能改变这样一个事实，不知何故，这实际上是我们所有人都在做的事情。我们今天都在努力工作，希望明天、下个星期、下个月或一年后我们会快乐、满足和充实。
这让我想到了另一个改变了一切的问题：如果我不享受实现梦想和目标的方式，那追逐远大梦想和目标的意义何在？
我对这个问题没有一个明确的答案，所以，在某种程度上，我的答案是拖延。一方面，我想建立一家企业，创造伟大的东西。另一方面，只要我不知道如何在做的同时感到快乐，我就不想在任何事情上(努力)工作！
在经历了几个月和忙碌的文书工作后，我搬到了德国，我的数字游牧生活又开始了。从那以后，我花了3年多的时间，周游世界，探索，享受乐趣，创造回忆。我活在许多人梦寐以求的梦想中。A过着没有任何常规的生活，想什么时候起床就什么时候起床，想什么时候工作就什么时候工作，明天总是一场计划外的冒险。
你可以说一切都是完美的，但是，旧的梦想仍然困扰着我，我想建立和创造一个成功的企业，我自己的企业。我从来不喜欢为某人工作并用我的时间换取金钱的想法。在乐趣和拖延之间，我试图建立一些东西和自我引导的想法，但事情总是落在夹缝里。有了这样的生活方式，真的很难对外面阳光明媚的海滩说不，然后去做10个小时的副业。因此，拖延症成了我新的生活方式。
我离开墨西哥去旧金山进行为期两周的旅行，今年我有很多旅行计划。如果不是新冠肺炎的话，事情至少还会像以前一样走几年的路。
疫情爆发两周后，我发现自己没有工作，也没有其他事情可做。没有旅行，没有朋友，什么都没有。这一次，我不仅有很多空闲时间，而且我所有的时间都变成了空闲时间。历史有机会重演，我要做一个决定。我想重新开始2017年的生活吗？我想让自己忙于副业和没完没了的工作吗？
3年前的感觉还历历在目，我不想再掉进那个陷阱。那是一个我必须利用的机会。我独自生活，没有任何分心的事情，这是一个重新发现我自己和我真正想要的东西的机会。
我的目标是在平衡工作和生活的同时创业。我不想花14个小时在我的笔记本电脑上，感觉它正在吸走我的生命。我相信有可能在不陷入工作狂沼泽的情况下自力更生。
今年早些时候，我在左下角的某个地方。为了向右转，我不得不解决我的拖延症问题。因为我以前没有尝试过任何对我有用的东西，所以我决定尽我所能地学习这门学科，并挑战自己，写一本关于它的书，这本书！我试图向我自己(和其他人)证明，生活在中间是可能的，一个你可以高效和快乐的地方。
“一鸟在手胜过十鸟在林(̶w̶o̶ten in the Bush)”
我最好的朋友经营着一家在线企业，拥有大约30万ARR，他的情况正好相反。他是我所认识的最敬业、最努力的人，但他并不快乐。当我问他这件事时，他说他不相信有这样的平衡是可能的。对他来说，你不可能既高效(成长得足够快)又快乐。他的目标是在40岁之前拥有一家稳定的大企业，这样他就可以在那时放松并享受生活。
我不想那样，如果我的幸福就是代价，我就不想做生意。我不想生活在30%的幸福中，因为我承诺未来的自己在五年或十年内会达到100%。这不仅是因为100%的幸福是不现实的，而且我相信未来的我仍然会被困在同一个仓鼠轮子上，说服自己还需要5年才能达到想象中的完美幸福。
工作狂会使你盲目，你不再看到大局，你没有时间去思考和重新思考，你为了工作本身而工作。如果没有合适的系统和定期停车，你会停下来仔细检查你要去的地方，车轮只会越来越快地旋转，直到它最终把你吐出来，把你扔到墙上。
我知道，有时候你有一些让你非常兴奋的事情，但感觉不像是工作。但纯粹的兴奋不会永远持续下去。最终，您将不得不处理项目中其他乏味和不那么令人兴奋的部分。一旦最初的兴奋消退，你要么辞职，要么闭上眼睛，踩下油门，变成一个工作狂僵尸。
然而，生活并不容易，你不能总是在放松和放松的同时完成事情。有时你别无选择，只能如此努力，几天、几周、甚至几个月。当你不知道什么时候抬脚离开油门踏板环顾四周，看看你要去哪里，检查你是否应该转弯和改变方向时，问题就开始了。
所以让我们把所有的碎片粘在一起。拖延者拥有这只即时满足的猴子，它想要立即的回报，享受乐趣，享受这一刻，而不是对未来一丝不苟。工作狂有一个恐慌症怪物，他想要如此努力地工作，牺牲今天的一切，这样你明天就能快乐起来。
问题的答案是：“如何在不剥夺自己幸福的情况下追逐远大梦想？”这个问题的答案也是一样的：“你的即时快感猴子可以在哪里遇到你的惊恐怪物？”你两者都需要。猴子和怪物一样重要，我们将在“多产的拖延者”一章中看到这一点。而在其他章节中，我们试图找到那个契合点，因为本书的唯一目的不是帮助你成为一个富有成效的人，而是帮助你成为一个快乐的有成效的人。
📕这一章是我即将出版的书“TL；DR--一位拖延症大师写的关于生产力的书”的一部分。如果你喜欢这本书，请点击这里查看更多。

I was working for a startup based in Jerusalem called Curiyo. Back then I had a nice routine: I wake up around 6 am, go to the gym with my buddy, come back to my room to take a shower, eat a bowl of salad and then leave for work. I get to work around 9 am, leave around 5 to meet friends, hang out, or do whatever activity I was planning for that evening.
 In September of the same year, I went on my first trip abroad. I went with my best friend from high school on a 2-week trip to Italy. And as they say, I caught the travel bug. After that trip, all I could think about was planning the next ones and when I could fly again. And since then, I started traveling literally every month.
 One day, I found a blog post about digital nomads and remote work. "This is it, this is what I want!", I said to myself, and the race began to figure out how I could make that happen. A couple of months later, I landed my first remote job with Toptal and signed up for a 3-month trip around southeast Asia (SEA). And in September 2016 -a year after my first trip- I was in Thailand working remotely, enjoying the beach, drinking fresh coconut water, and calling myself a digital nomad.
 "Work hard, play harder": that is the digital nomad slogan. Each day’s schedule looked different from the day before, depending on what I felt like doing or what the group I’m with is planning. In other words, it’s impossible to have a fixed routine, you have to be flexible and dynamic. Otherwise, you will either have to choose between FOMO or doing a shitty job at your work so you don’t miss whatever fun others are having.
  After my 3-month trip to SEA, it was time to go back to Jerusalem to see my family and plan the next move. I wasn’t excited to go back, I grew up in Jerusalem and till that point, it’s where I spent all my life. It was so hard and boring after what I’ve experienced, I just came back after spending 3 months in heaven.
 Suddenly there were no more beaches, no more parties, or random strangers to hang out with. There was a lot of free time thatI had no idea what to do with. All I was doing every day was leaving my parents’ house, go to the university campus where I spent five years getting my computer engineering degree, and work till it’s so hard to keep my eyes open.
 I filled all the free time I had with work. I created an outsource web development company with a friend and worked 14h a day 7 days a week, I became a workaholic. I was hoping that by creating a successful business I will have the means to escape my city and move elsewhere to go back to the heavenly life I had for a short period.
 After 3 months of long days and restless nights mishmash, I realized that wasn’t what I wanted. Of course, I still wanted to build my own business, but I didn’t like the path I was taking. And one day I found myself writing this:
 I woke up late, as usual, tried to open my exhausted eyelids. I had skipped the usual question “What’s the plan for today?” and left my bed. It has been almost 3 months since the last time I answered that question, after the first week of going back to Jerusalem it was the same day repeating itself over and over again. Wake up, go to the university campus, meet the same people, and work for 12-14 hours.
 Everything was the same that day except one thing, one thought. When suddenly I found myself shouting out loud to myself “Oh shit, I’m not happy, FUCK!” after a voice inside my head asked: “Are you happy?”. The answer was obviously no. I just realized I was on auto-pilot and forgot to ask myself such a trivial question. “If you are not happy, what is the point?” I kept asking myself for the rest of the day.
 Work was just my way to escape reality and fill my free time. All that made me wonder: do I have to bury myself in work and live miserably now so that my future self can be happy?
 Probably many of you will say “yes”, or maybe you will hesitate a bit before saying “no”. But that doesn’t change the fact that it is actually what we all do somehow. All of us work hard today hoping that tomorrow, next week, next month, or a year from now we will be happy, satisfied, and fulfilled.
 This led me to another question that has changed everything:  what is the point of chasing big dreams and goals if I'm not enjoying the way to get there?
 I didn’t have a clear answer to this question so, in a way or another, my answer was  procrastination. On one side, I wanted to build a business and create great things. On the other side, I didn’t want to work (hard) on anything as long as I don’t know how to be happy while doing it!
  After several months and hustling paperwork, I moved to Germany, and my digital nomad life was on again. Since then, I’ve spent the last 3+ years, traveling around the world, exploring, having fun, and creating memories. I was living the dream that many people dream of. A was living a life with no routine whatsoever, wake up whenever I want, work whenever I want, and tomorrow is always an unplanned adventure.
 You can say everything was perfect, but still, the old dream was bugging me, I want to build and create a successful business, my own business. I never liked the idea of working for someone and trading my time for money. And between fun and procrastination, I was trying to build stuff and bootstrap ideas, but things were always falling between the cracks. With a lifestyle like that, it’s really hard to say no to the sunny beach outside and go work 10 hours on a side project. So as a result, procrastination became my new lifestyle.
  I left Mexico for a 2-week trip to San Francisco, I had a lot of traveling planned for this year. Things would have stayed on the same path as before for at least another couple of years if it wasn’t for COVID-19.
 Two weeks into the pandemic, I found myself without work and without anything else to do. No travel, no friends around, nothing. This time, I didn’t only have a lot of free time, but all my time became free time. History got a chance to repeat itself, and I had a decision to make. Do I want to re-live 2017 all over again? Do I want to keep myself busy with side projects and endless work?
 The feeling from 3 years ago was still fresh in my memory that I didn’t want to fall into that trap again. That was an opportunity I had to take advantage of. I was living alone with no distraction of any kind, It was a chance to rediscover myself and what I really want.
 My goal was to bootstrap a business while having a work life balance. I didn’t want to spend 14 hours on my laptop and feel like it was sucking the life out of me. I believed it was possible to bootstrap without falling into the workaholism swamp.
  Earlier this year I was somewhere on the bottom left side. To shift toward the right I had to deal with my procrastination problem. Since nothing I’ve tried before worked for me, I decided to learn everything I can about the subject and challenge myself to write a book about it, this book! I’m trying to prove to myself (and others) that it’s possible to live in the middle, a place where you can be productive and happy.
 “A bird in the hand is worth t̶w̶o̶ ten in the bush”
 My best friend, who is running an online business with ~$300k ARR, is on the opposite side of the curve. He is the most dedicated hard working person I know, but he’s not happy. When I asked him about it, he said he doesn’t believe it’s possible to have that balance. For him, you can’t be productive (grow fast enough) and happy at the same time. His goal is to have a big stable business by age 40 so he can relax and enjoy life then.
 I don’t want that, I don't want to build a business if my happiness is the price. I don't want to live on 30% happiness for the promise that my future self will be 100% in five or ten years. It's not only that 100% happiness is not realistic, but I also believe my future self will still be stuck on the same hamster wheel convincing himself that he needs another 5 years to get to the imaginary perfect happiness.
  Workaholism will blind you, you no longer see the big picture, you have no time to think and re-think, and you work for the sake of the work itself. And without a proper system and regular stops where you pause to double-check where you are heading, the wheel will just spin faster and faster until it eventually spits you out and throws you against the wall.
 I know, sometimes you have something you are so excited about and it doesn’t feel like work. But pure excitement doesn’t last forever. Eventually, you will have to work on other boring and less exciting parts of your project. And once that initial excitement fades away, you either quit or close your eyes and hit the gas pedal to become a workaholic zombie.
 However, life is not easy and you can’t always accomplish things while relaxing and taking it easy. Sometimes you have no other option but to push so hard, for days, weeks, or even months. The problem starts when you have no idea when you are going to lift your foot off the gas pedal to look around and see where you are going and check if you should make a turn and change directions.
 So let’s glue all pieces together. A Procrastinator has this  Instant Gratification Monkey who wants immediate rewards, to have fun, and enjoy the moment without giving a shit about the future. A workaholic has a  Panic Monster who wants to work so hard and sacrifice everything today so you can be happy tomorrow.
 The answer to the question: “How do you chase big dreams and without depriving yourself happiness?” is the same answer to the question: “Where could your instant gratification monkey meet your panic monster?” You need both.The monkey is as important as the monster, we’ll see that in the chapter “The Productive Procrastinator”. While in other chapters, we try to find that meeting point, as the sole purpose of this book is not to help you just be a productive person but a  happy productive person.
    📕 This chapter is part of my upcoming book  “TL;DR — a book about productivity by a procrastination master”. If you enjoyed this one, check out more  HERE.

我想新冠肺炎对我们很多人再次强调了自力更生的价值。在这场大流行期间，我们经历了一段时间，我们不能简单地拿起电话，打电话找人来我们家修理。我们也可能无法去当地的商店寻求帮助。由于现在我们的很多个人事务都必须在网上进行，所以寻找便宜的电脑并对我们自己的电脑进行基本维修正成为重要的生活技能。没有他们，我们可能无法与世界保持联系，无法上学，无法工作，甚至无法购买食物而不冒着接触潜在致命疾病的风险。
幸运的是，修理一台电脑或买一台便宜的二手电脑并不像许多人认为的那么困难。所需要的就是学会亲力亲为地做这些事情的意愿。个人必须愿意承担与尝试修理自己的计算机或在网上购买二手计算机相关的风险。对于大多数人来说，我认为这是他们从未克服的绊脚石。能做这些事情的人和不能做这些事情的人的区别不是智力。这只不过是让他们通过绊脚石的足够的需要和兴趣。如果你愿意学习，你就会赢得计算机自力更生的战斗。我不会告诉你，你有时不会感到沮丧。我只想说，如果你不断尝试，你会学到这些技能的。
在本文中，我将概述解决大多数基本计算机维修问题所需的知识和技能。但首先，我将解释一个简单的步骤，你现在就可以采取的一个简单的步骤，就是在你的家里任何时候都有一台可以正常工作的计算机。

I think Covid-19 has re-emphasized the value of self-reliance to many of us. During this pandemic, we have been through periods when we couldn't simply pick up a phone and call someone to come to our home to make repairs. We may also have been unable to go to a local shop to get help. Since so much of our personal business must now be conducted on line, finding inexpensive computers and making basic repairs to our own computers are becoming important life skills. Without them, we may be unable to stay connected to the world, to attend school, to work, or even to buy food without risking exposure to a potentially deadly disease.
  Fortunately, repairing a computer or buying a cheap used one is not as difficult as many people seem to believe. All that is needed is the will to learn to do these things in a hands-on way. Individuals must be willing to take the risks associated with trying to repair their own computers or buying used computers on line. For most people, I think this is the stumbling block that they never overcome. What separates the people who can do these things from those who cannot is not intelligence. It is nothing more than need and interest sufficient to get them past the stumbling block. If you are willing to learn, you will win the battle for computer self-reliance. I will not tell you that you will not be frustrated at times. I will only say that, if you keep trying, you will learn these skills.
  In this article, I will outline the knowledge and skills that are necessary to solve most basic computer repair problems. But first, I will explain one simple step that you can take right now to have a working computer in your home at all times.
  Have a working backup computer in your home to use in the event of the death or loss of your primary computer. A backup computer need not be expensive. In fact, you can buy a useful, used computer on Ebay for around $50. The role of this computer is only to get you on line to do research or to buy parts or other necessities until you can get your primary computer working again, or until you can buy another computer. A rather  old computer is capable of meeting these needs. Some of you may want to use a cellphone for this, and that will work if your cellphone service includes a data plan. However, for reasons that will become clear later, a fully-functioning computer would be better. I have written several articles on cheapskatesguide.org that explain how to buy a cheap computer on line. For suggestions about multiple approaches to getting a cheap laptop, read  this article. For recommendations regarding the best used laptops to buy for less than $100 in the year 2020, read  this. To obtain a more in-depth understanding of the art of buying a computer that meets your needs, go to the  Core Articles page and read the articles there in chronological order.
  Now, let me talk about what you need to know to make basic computer repairs. If you take good care of your computer, the only computer repair that you are likely to need that is not basic is the replacement of your motherboard. So, if your computer is completely dead or stops booting at the BIOS screen (both symptoms of a bad motherboard), it is most likely time to buy another computer. If any life at all remains in your computer--if you hear beep codes (beeping sounds when you turn on your computer), see a repeating pattern of flashing lights, or see an error message on the monitor--you may be looking at a computer that you can repair with basic skills. Below, are the skills that everyone can learn and then use to make basic computer repairs. Everyone should be able to:
         When you think about it, that is a rather short list. I think that a simple lack of desire is the only thing that prevents most people from obtaining these skills. In this article, I will not teach you these skills. I will tell you what you need to know and a little about how to find that knowledge. I will tell you how to develop the skills. And, in some cases, I will outline basic repair procedures and tell you how to fill in the details yourself.
         Most symptoms of computer problems are pretty obvious. Your keyboard stops working. A USB connector stops working. Your computer's monitor doesn't light up. A message appears on your monitor saying that no operating system was found. Your computer's sound stops working. The question is not whether a problem exists but whether it is a software problem or a hardware problem. The easiest way to rule out a hardware problem is to boot your computer from a reliable, bootable Linux USB flash drive. If the problem does not go away, then you most likely have a hardware problem. One obvious exception is that the problem will go away if your hard drive is bad. I recommend creating a bootable Linux Mint USB flash drive, making sure it works with every piece of hardware on your computer, and setting it aside for when you need it. Another benefit of having a Linux USB flash drive is that if your hard drive dies, you will still be able to use your computer to get online.
  If the problem is caused by software, an online search will give you possible sources and procedures to follow to narrow down the problem to one source. If an error message appears, use an online search engine to search for that exact error message with quotes around it. If you have no error message, you may have more difficulty finding information about the exact source of your problem. This process can sometimes take several hours, but you are likely to eventually find hints that will lead you to solutions for most computer software problems, especially if the software is common. On a modern laptop computer, the battery and hard drive are the only parts that are likely to fail that you can replace with basic skills. In over 30 years of owning computers, I have never had a single stick of RAM fail. I have had RAM sticks that have become unseated from their connectors and needed to be pushed back into place. Beep codes or flashing lights can give you a hint that RAM has become unseated. Search on line for "computer beep codes" to find the specific beep codes for your computer.
  You generally only need to know three things to locate a hard drive or Solid State Drive (SSD) that is compatible with your computer: the hard drive's width, its thickness, and the type of connector to which it connects. You need to buy a replacement hard drive that will physically fit into the space in your computer, and the connector of the hard drive must connect to the connector on your computer's motherboard. These days, all spinning hard drives are either 2.5 or 3.5 inches wide with SATA connectors. Most regular-sized desktop computers have 3.5 inch hard drives, but a laptop will never have a 3.5 inch hard drive. Laptops have either 2.5 inch spinning hard drives or some kind of SSD. If your computer has an SSD, you will have to open up your computer and look at the SSD's connector. Unfortunately, these days, there are a small number of solid state drive connector types that have the same physical connections but are different electrically. In my opinion, this was a very poor design decision. Luckily, these SSD's are the only example in the computer industry of which I am aware of this being allowed to occur. Find a picture of your SSD's connector online and see what type of connector the online source says it is. Wikipedia is a good place to look for this type of information. Once you have identified the type of connector on your SSD, see what Wikipedia says about its electrical arrangement. Do not try to use an SSD with a different type of electrical arrangement, because this is likely to damage the replacement SSD and your computer.
         When your computer develops a problem, you can almost always find a procedure on line for solving it. First, you need to know  what to do to repair a generic computer with the specific problem you are seeing. You can read on line about  what to do to repair the problem on a generic Windows, Mac, or Linux computer. Then, if the problem is a hardware problem, you need to know  how to physically accomplish the repair of your specific model of computer. A Youtube video can be beneficial for this. An example of what I mean by " how to physically repair" is the following. When you open the back of your laptop, what screws do you have to unscrew to release the hard drive? Do you pull the hard drive straight out perpendicularly from the back of the laptop? Or, do you slide it parallel to the back of the laptop before pulling it out? Youtube videos will answer these types of questions. Manufacturers also publish manuals for technicians that explain how to disassemble and re-assemble each model of laptop. These can be extremely helpful, and most can be found on line.
  Generally, the best teacher is trial-and-error. With computer repairs, as with most things related to computers, you learn the most by hands-on experience. This is especially true when you cannot find a sufficient quality or quantity of information on line. Often you can solve a problem by trying things until something works.
         You will need to change your computer's boot order in BIOS to boot from a Linux USB flash drive. UEFI has replaced the BIOS in computers manufactured after about 2011. If your computer uses UEFI instead of BIOS, you may also need to turn off "secure boot" to boot from a Linux USB stick. The procedures for getting to the BIOS or UEFI settings menu of different models of computers are different. You can look for the exact procedure for your model by searching on line for the name of your model followed by "changing boot order". Or, once you have read how to change the boot order on a couple of models of computers, you can use trial-and-error to discover how to do it on your model.
         An online search will yield a procedure for creating a bootable Linux USB drive. All you need is a computer, a free piece of software like Linux Live USB Creator, and a USB flash drive.
         We usually make broad distinctions when we talk about software. We group it into one of the following categories: application software, hardware drivers, operating systems, and firmware. Windows, MacOS, and Linux are operating systems. Application software is generally software that a user installs on his computer depending on what he wants his computer to be able to do. Microsoft Office, DOOM 3, Skype, and VLC Video Player are examples of application software. Firmware is software that resides on a chip, rather than on a computer's hard drive. BIOS is an example of firmware.
  Hardware drivers are software that interface a computer's peripherals with its operating system. A peripheral is a piece of computer hardware--other than a power supply, battery, or RAM--that connects to the motherboard, either inside the computer or via an external connector like a USB, HDMI, or other type of port. The motherboard is the main electronics board where reside the chips that make up the computer, including the CPU. The motherboard generally takes up most of the interior of a laptop. Some examples of peripherals are monitors, hard drives, USB drives, keyboards, mice, cameras, wifi cards, sound cards, speakers, and microphones. Every peripheral has a hardware driver that must be correctly installed for the peripheral to work properly. Windows device manager can tell you if a particular hardware driver has been install correctly. Many basic hardware drivers come with the Windows operating system, but many drivers must be obtained from the manufacturer of the computer or the manufacturer of the peripheral.
  When installing software onto a blank hard drive, the order of installation is as follows. First make sure the hard drive is partitioned and formatted the way you want. Then, install the operating system. Next, install the hardware drivers. Last, install the application software. You will find many websites that explain how to install operating systems. The computer manufacturer's website is the best place to go to find hardware drivers for your particular model of computer. Many websites explain how to install hardware drivers on specific operating systems. The website of the company selling a particular application software package is one place to go to learn how to install that particular software, but better explanations can often be found on unrelated websites.
  If your computer software is exhibiting anomalous behavior that you find egregious, wiping the hard drive completely and re-installing all the software is one solution. You can also rid your computer of viruses and other malware this way. While re-installing all the software is conceptually simple, it can take a few hours. Some computers have hidden partitions, called recovery partitions, on their hard drives that contain a compressed copy of all the software on the computer. A procedure exists for resetting these computers to "factory default" which allows you to bring all the software back to the exact state that it was in on the day you bought the computer. The advantage of this is that the entire process can take less than twenty minutes and be done automatically, instead of requiring hours of your time. You can determine if your computer has a recovery partition by searching online for that information about your model of computer. This should also be covered in the computer's user's manual. If you no longer have your computer's user's manual, you can almost always find an electronic copy on line.
  Solving problems associated with certain misbehaving software without re-installing all the software on your computer may sometimes be more complicated but can often take much less time. In order to fix one misbehaving piece of software, you may also have to fix certain broken parts of the operating system or re-install missing or corrupted hardware drivers. Sometimes this can require more knowledge and diagnostic skill than is required to re-install all the software on your computer. Sometimes the level of knowledge required is not easily obtainable via Internet searches.
  Troubleshooting a misbehaving piece of software generally proceeds as follows. First, reboot your computer. If the problem persists, try wiping the problematic software off your hard drive and re-installing it. If the problem still persists, look for a solution on line. An online search may be successful if you can identify key words associated with specific symptoms. If you cannot find a solution on line and you suspect that the problem may be due to an incomplete installation of the software, look for the installation script that is used to install the software. If an installation script is used, it may provide you with clues. However, you will most likely not understand what you are seeing. The next step would be to learn the scripting language, get a debugger, and run the script through it until the error occurs. At this point, you would be doing engineering, and I don't expect anyone to go this far. If you cannot find other software that can perform the function that you desperately need to have performed, the only thing left to try is wiping the hard drive and re-installing all the software. Only do this if a strong indication exists that this may solve the problem.
  The ability to re-install an operating system is a particularly important skill to develop. If you can re-install an operating system, you can replace an old hard drive with a new one. You can get your computer running again if certain critical operating system files become corrupt for whatever reason. You can solve the problem known as "Windows rot", where Windows computers tend to run increasingly slowly over a period of a year or two. You can switch operating systems after Microsoft stops supporting or upgrading your computer's current operating system. And, as I mentioned, you may solve some software problems that could otherwise not be solved with your current level of knowledge.
  Installing hardware drivers can be a pain in the neck. Sometimes, installation does not go the way it is supposed to. You often have to make several attempts at installing Windows hardware drivers, and for some reason after the first four failed attempts, the fifth attempt succeeds, and you don't know why. Driver installation is something you can learn to do for your particular operating system by searching for a procedure on line. But, no substitute exists for doing it enough times that you have begun to feel more comfortable. Some computer manufacturers now provide diagnostic utilities on their websites that automatically download and install many of the drivers required by a particular model of computer.
  While I am on the subject of misbehaving software, let me just say a few words about Microsoft's official website. I have rarely found a solution to a software problem there, so don't waste your time there. "Solutions" presented there read like they were written by a Microsoft engineer who was being paid by the word and could not have cared less about helping customers find solutions. This is the type of engineer that gives engineers a bad name. Are you reading this, Satya Nadella?
         A computer storage drive may fail slowly and subtly over time, or it may fail suddenly. Hard drives often fail slowly. When a hard drive is starting to go bad, the first sign may be that the computer takes much longer to boot--like 5, 10, or even 20 minutes. The computer may also be much slower when certain programs are trying to run. Hard drive diagnostic software that can be found on online for free may help you determine with more certainty that your hard drive is dying. Operating systems also have limited hard drive diagnostic software. For example, Windows has chkdsk. Information exists on line that can help you to interpret the results you obtain from diagnostic software. SSD's fail suddenly, without warning. The death of a hard drive or SSD may be indicated by an error message when the computer tries to boot that may read something like "No boot device found" or "No operating system found." Or, you may just see a flashing cursor on a black background. If you see one of these, but you can boot successfully from a Linux USB stick, then the problem is most likely your hard drive. This may not be true if you have your BIOS set to boot from a USB stick and you have a non-bootable USB stick plugged into your computer. In that case, your computer may simply not know to ignore the non-bootable USB stick and boot from the hard drive.
  The time to act is when you suspect that a hard drive is starting to fail. Don't wait until it has completely given up the ghost. First, backup all the data that you care about. Then, try to determine if the hard drive is dying or if something else is occurring. Sometimes you can reformat a failing hard drive and re-install all the software to get your computer working again temporarily. But, if the hard drive is going bad, it will die again in a few days or weeks. If this happens, you can save yourself much frustration by simply buying a new hard drive. They are fairly inexpensive these days.
  If you have data on a failed hard drive that you absolutely must recover, before you take it to professional data extractors, you may want to try Steve Gibson's spinrite program ($90).
  Assuming you had the foresight to buy a computer with a replaceable hard drive or SSD, the physical replacement of the hard drive is very easy. But, you should take a few precautions to avoid damaging your hard drive and/or computer. 在克罗地亚一个阳光明媚、万里无云的下午，一股被称为博拉(Bora)的狂风可以席卷维莱比特山脉和亚得里亚海。当它达到飓风强度时，这种寒冷、干燥的风会使陡峭、干旱的地形在中午结冰。
这一沿海地区以岩溶为主，岩溶是一种多孔的岩石地形。尽管该地区的条件充满挑战，但人类在数千年前就在这里勉强维持了生存。
克罗地亚扎达尔大学的考古学家Vedrana Glavaš就是在这片土地上长大的。“那是我小时候玩耍的地方，我对历史和史前产生了兴趣，”她回忆道。
2014年，她和一个团队在维莱比特山工作时，发现了一座有3000年历史的山堡和墓地的一部分。为了进一步探索，她需要更多的帮助。2015年，格拉瓦·平塔尔(Glavaš)偶然发现了一项令人惊讶而廉价的创新：她与训犬师安德里亚·平塔(Andrea Pintar)合作，他的公司狗咖啡馆(Canine Caffe)提供专门的“身体”狗，帮助警方嗅探悬案，为当地官员寻找乱葬岗。
Glavaš解释说：“安德里亚处理的一些警察案件已经有30年的历史了。”“我们都想知道她的狗能闻到多久以前的气味。”他们没有想到的是，这些狗会把他们带到公元前8世纪埋葬的遗骸。
Glavaš与平塔尔在2018年发表了她的研究成果，她说，这些狗最终发现了六个以上独特的坟墓，其中一个距离其他坟墓约50米。Glavaš挖掘了其中的六个坟墓，发现了石质埋藏箱、文物和人类的手指和脚趾骨骼。
Glavaš说，事实证明，这些狗是无价的，它独特地增强了寻找坟墓的典型方法的能力，如实地勘测、航空摄影、红外线卫星成像、探地雷达和其他技术。格拉瓦š并不是唯一一个求助于警犬侦探的考古学家。
长期以来，狗一直是人类最好的朋友--无畏的保护者，忠诚的伴侣，出色的飞盘运动员--现在看来，它们也可能是考古学家的理想伴侣。像gravaš和pintar一样，研究人员正在利用一只训练有素的犬类发现遗骸的成熟能力，证明这种技能可以磨练成捕猎更古老的猎物的能力。
一项新的研究表明，一只训练有素的幼犬可以从数百年前的遗骸中闻到所谓的死亡气味。它们到底嗅出了什么化合物仍然是个谜，但这些狗的努力可能有助于阐明过去的几千年来的情况。
狗的鼻子至少比我们的好一万倍。具体地说，狗会接触到低分子量的化合物，这些化合物在室温下很容易蒸发，而且经常带有一种气味-科学家所说的挥发性有机化合物。犬类可以检测到每万亿个这样的部分中的一个。
因此，狗表现出了不可思议的嗅觉能力。他们已经嗅出了人类的黑色素瘤皮肤癌，并仅通过在体液中闻到气味就检测到了奶牛的怀孕。
那么，犬类在考古挖掘中到底探测到了什么呢？“我们的狗实际上并不是在寻找骨头，”Glavaš强调。“他们正在寻找人类分解的分子。”
在人类遗骸的情况下，狗可能会嗅到几种特定分子中的一种。一种可能性是狗检测到了尸蜡中的脂肪酸，科学家们已经注意到这种物质几个世纪了，被称为“尸蜡”或“墓地的脂肪”。
这种脂肪是自然分解的副产品。人体脂肪被细菌转化为游离脂肪酸，然后变硬成肥皂状的脂肪组织，可以有效地使死者成为木乃伊。
这种材料可以帮助科学家测定身体的年代。阿迪西伯雷坚持认为冰冻的遗骸估计有300多年的历史，比如在加拿大不列颠哥伦比亚省西北部冰川融化中发现的那些冰川融化的遗骸。2009年，科学家报告了在德国一名1600岁儿童遗骸上发现的尸节。
狗也可能会注意到动物脂肪中存在的一种叫做酯的化合物。2015年的一项研究发现了五种人类独有的酯类。水分、日照、温度、土壤质量和成分都会影响骨骼散发出多少香味。
渗入岩石和土壤中的气味化合物可能会被困住数千年。举例来说，格拉瓦š怀疑岩溶多孔的表面可能会特别好地保存这些分子。
狗的嗅觉超能力能追溯到什么时候仍然是一个悬而未决的问题。哥本哈根大学和剑桥大学的考古学家马修·柯林斯(Matthew Collins)联合研究遗迹中古代蛋白质的持久性，其中一些蛋白质持续了100多万年。
柯林斯怀疑犬科动物能否检测到这些真正老化的标本。狗嗅出的分子是分解后产生的，柯林斯感兴趣的蛋白质只存在于保存完好、没有腐烂的遗骸中。
尽管如此，柯林斯认为狗是考古学上的盟友。“狗的鼻子非常灵敏，”他说，并指着加拿大西北部的探险家们用狗伴儿寻找猛犸象象牙的故事。
“雷尘的昆托”是一只7岁的纯种黑人德国牧羊犬的正式名字。他被朋友们称为“法贝尔”，在许多方面，他是一只典型的爱他的人类的喧闹的狗-而且喜欢爆米花，这是他最喜欢的食物。
他也是一只训练有素的考古犬。他眼睛明亮，警觉十足，等待他的主人，瑞典考古学家索菲·瓦卢夫戴上马具和项圈(上面实际上写着“考古犬”)，然后他就去上班了。
瓦卢夫说，只要他一开始，他的性格就会改变。她说：“他从我们愚蠢、顽皮的法贝尔变成了完全专注、完全不合群的人。”“他不喜欢我在他工作的时候离他太近。”
法贝尔为一次成功的会议而招待的是他最喜欢的绿球。瓦卢夫补充说：“他喜欢他的绿球，当他打完后，我只是简单地把球扔给他。”
她指出，德国牧羊犬是完成这项任务的理想品种。“他们喜欢工作，这就是为什么他们是一条公共服务犬，”她说。“法贝尔和我是梦之队。…。他是个彻头彻尾的工作狂，精力充沛。“。她现在也在训练她年轻的德国牧羊犬卡西迪。
瓦卢夫在2013年开始训练法贝尔，当时他只有5个月大。她发表了她的硕士论文，内容是在室内无菌实验室环境下与法贝尔进行实验。“我想看看他是否能区分动物和人的骨头，”她说。“这一点非常重要，因为我们想要找到的是人类骨骼遗骸。”
瓦卢夫设计了搜索，让法贝尔必须识别人类或非人类动物的骨骼遗骸。该团队总共进行了120次搜索，每一次都有四个骨骼遗骸选项，其中只有一个样本来自人类。“作为一名操作员，我不知道哪个罐子里装的是正确的气味，”她说，“这样我就不会在我自己都不知道的情况下给他发送线索。”瓦卢夫发现，法贝尔可以以94.2%以上的准确率区分人和动物的遗骸。
瓦卢夫指出，他们最好的作品是在桑德比博格(Sandby Borg)，这是瑞典东海岸外奥兰岛上的一个戒备森严的定居点，可以追溯到一千多年前。在那里，法贝尔发现了埋在5英尺深的1600年前的人类遗骸。
“这是我们完成大部分工作的地方，”瓦卢夫说。“这也是我们测试很多新点子的地方。”例如，她用GPS追踪法贝尔的行动，记录他检查过的位置。这一措施很有帮助，因为这只永远好奇的狗移动得如此之快，以至于她不可能跟上它。
与此同时，在北美，另一个项目正在将考古犬的发现推向更远的过去。2018年，当时在卡罗尔学院(Carroll College)的人类学家劳里·特拉维斯(Lauri Travis)与学生汉娜·德克尔(Hannah Decker)合作，看看当时12周大的边境牧羊犬和澳大利亚牧羊犬混血儿达克斯(Dax)是否可以接受培训，以检测过去人类狩猎和食用的哺乳动物的骨骼。
特拉维斯解释说：“我想知道蒙大拿州的原住民在两次重要的干旱期间吃了什么，一次是8000年前的，另一次是2000年前的。”DAX可以帮上忙。
德克尔在大学最后一年的大部分时间里都在训练达克斯(以一个勇敢的星际迷航角色命名)。“狗一直是我的爱好，如果不和它们一起工作，我就不会成为今天的我，”她说。
首先在室内，然后在室外，德克尔在训练练习中使用了来自非人类哺乳动物的真实骨骼，这些骨骼的年代确定得很正确。在某些情况下，她用手套处理样本，以避免任何可能污染它们的直接接触。“我从把骨头磨成粉末状开始，因为这样可以增加表面积和气味，”她解释说。
德克尔把骨灰和玩具搭配在一起，放在地上让达克斯发现。后来，她干脆把骨灰藏了起来，最后，她开始把整块骨头埋在地下几英寸的地方。达克斯学会了用一连串的吠叫来表示她发现了什么东西。
训练结束时，达克斯可以在10个月前发现埋在6英寸深的骨头。在一次这样的实验中，她发现了3500多年前的动物骨骼。到2019年8月，这只狗在地上发现了完整的哺乳动物骨骼，特拉维斯报告说，最近，达克斯发现了一块5000年前的骨头，埋在12英寸深。
特拉维斯现在全职照顾达克斯。她与这只狗一起工作，以确定可能包含古代哺乳动物骨骼的考古遗址-来自野牛、鹿、麋鹿或兔子等动物，这些动物可能是当时土著人民饮食的一部分。特拉维斯说：“我们一直在寻找新的工具来帮助我们的工作，我认为嗅探犬在未来可能会被证明真的很有用。”
想象一下-一只顽强、快乐的考古犬在蒙大拿州的冰雪中滑行，嗅出一只来自不可想象的亿万年前的古代有蹄类动物的碎片。

On a sunny, cloudless afternoon in Croatia, a fierce wind known as a bora can whip over the Velebit mountain range and across the Adriatic Sea. When it reaches hurricane force, this cold, dry wind can render the steep, arid terrain freezing at midday.
 This coastal region is dominated by karst, a porous rock topography. Despite the area’s challenging conditions, humans eked out an existence here thousands of years ago.
 Archaeologist Vedrana Glavaš, at the University of Zadar in Croatia, grew up in this landscape. “That was where I played as a child and became interested in history and prehistory,” she reflects.
 In 2014, she and a team were working on Velebit mountain when they uncovered parts of a 3,000-year-old hill fort and necropolis. To explore further, she needed more help. In 2015, Glavaš hit upon a surprising and inexpensive innovation: She teamed up with dog trainer Andrea Pintar, whose company Canine Caffe offers specialized “cadaver” dogs that have helped sniff out cold cases for police and mass graves for local officials.
 “Some of the police cases Andrea has worked on are 30 years old,” explains Glavaš. “We both wondered how far back in time her dogs could smell.” What they did not expect was that the dogs would lead them to remains buried in the eighth century B.C.
 Glavaš, who with Pintar  published her research in 2018, says the dogs ultimately turned up more than six unique graves, one some 50 meters away from the rest. Glavaš excavated six of those graves, yielding stone burial chests, artifacts, and human finger and toe bones.
 The dogs proved invaluable, Glavaš says, uniquely enhancing the capability of typical methods for finding graves, such as field survey, aerial photography, infrared satellite imaging, ground-penetrating radar, and other technologies. And Glavaš isn’t the only archaeologist turning to canine detectives.
  Dogs have long been humans’ best friends—fearless protectors, loyal companions, fabulous Frisbee players—and now it seems they may be archaeologists’ ideal companions too. Like Glavaš and Pintar, researchers are building on a properly trained canine’s well-established ability to uncover remains, demonstrating that this skill can be honed to hunt much older quarry.
 New research demonstrates that a well-trained pup can pick up the so-called scents of death from remains that are centuries old. Precisely what compounds they’re sniffing out remains a mystery, but the dogs’ efforts could help illuminate bygone millennia.
  A dog’s nose performs at least  10,000 times better than ours. Specifically, dogs pick up on low-molecular-weight compounds that easily evaporate at room temperature and often carry an odor—what scientists call volatile organic compounds. Canines can detect one such part in every trillion.
 As a result, dogs have demonstrated uncanny olfactory abilities. They have sniffed out  melanoma skin cancer in humans and  detected pregnancy in cows just by picking up scents in their bodily fluids.
 So, what exactly are canines detecting at archaeological digs? “Our dogs are not actually searching for bones,” Glavaš emphasizes. “They are searching for the molecules of human decomposition.”
 In the case of human remains, dogs could be sniffing for one of several specific molecules. One possibility is that dogs detect the fatty acids in adipocere, a material scientists have noticed for centuries and referred to as “ corpse wax” or “the fat of graveyards.”
 This fat is a natural byproduct of decomposition. Human fat is converted into free fatty acids by bacteria, which then harden into the soap-like adipocere that can effectively mummify the dead.
 This material can help scientists date corpses.  Adipocere has persisted on frozen remains estimated to be more than 300 years old, such as those found in glacier melt in northwestern British Columbia, Canada. In 2009,  scientists reported on adipocere found on the remains of a 1,600-year-old child in Germany.
  Dogs could also be picking up on compounds called esters, present in animal fat. A 2015  study found five esters that were unique to humans. Moisture, sunlight, temperature and soil quality, and composition all influence how much scent bones will give off.
 Scent compounds that leach into rock and soil may be trapped for thousands of years. Glavaš suspects that karst’s porous surface, for example, might preserve these molecules especially well.
 How far back in time dogs’ olfactory superpowers go is still an open question. Archaeologist Matthew Collins, jointly at the University of Copenhagen and University of Cambridge, studies the persistence of ancient proteins in remains, some of which endure more than a million years.
 Collins doubts that canines can detect these truly aged specimens. The molecules that dogs sniff out are created as a consequence of decomposition, and the proteins Collins is interested in only exist in remains that are well-preserved, free of decay.
 Nonetheless, Collins sees dogs as archaeological allies. “Dogs’ noses are incredibly sensitive,” he says, pointing to tales of explorers in northwest Canada who used canine companions to find mammoth ivory.
 “Thunder Dust’s Quento” is the official name of a 7-year-old, pedigreed, black German shepherd. Known as “Fabel” to his friends, in many ways he’s a typical boisterous canine who loves his humans—and has a penchant for popcorn, his favorite treat.
 He’s also a trained archaeology dog. Bright-eyed and alert, he waits for his owner, Swedish archaeologist Sophie Vallulv, to put on his harness and collar (it actually says “archaeology dog”), and then he’s off to work.
 As soon as he begins, Vallulv says, his personality changes. “He goes from our goofy and playful Fabel to totally focused and not at all social,” she says. “He doesn’t like me being too close to him when he’s working.”
 Fabel’s treat for a successful session is his favorite green ball. “He loves his green ball, and I simply throw it to him when he’s done,” Vallulv adds.
 She notes that German shepherds are an ideal breed for this task. “They like to work, that’s why they are a common service dog,” she says. “Fabel and I are a dream team. … He’s an absolute workaholic, with a massive amount of energy.” She is now training her younger German shepherd, Cassidy, as well.
 Vallulv began training Fabel in 2013, when he was only 5 months old. She published  her master’s thesis on experiments with Fabel in an indoor sterile laboratory environment. “I wanted to see if he could distinguish between animal and human bones,” she says. “This was very important, since it was the human skeletal remains that we wanted to find.”
  Vallulv designed searches in which Fabel had to identify either human or nonhuman animal skeletal remains. Together, the team conducted 120 searches, each one with four options of skeletal remains in which only one sample was of human origin. “I as a handler had no idea which of the jars contained the right odor,” she says, “so that I wouldn’t send him clues without even knowing it myself.” Vallulv found that Fabel could tell the difference between human and animal remains with more than 94.2 percent accuracy.
 Their best work, Vallulv notes, has been in Sandby borg, a fortified settlement on the island of Öland, off the east coast of Sweden, that dates back more than a millennium. There, Fabel found 1,600-year-old human remains buried 5 feet deep.
 “This is the site [where] we’ve done most of our work,” Vallulv says. “It’s also where we test a lot of new ideas.” For instance, she tracks Fabel’s movements with GPS to record locations he’s checked. The measure helps because the ever-curious dog moves so quickly she cannot possibly keep up with him.
 Meanwhile, in North America, another project is pushing archaeology dog detection even further into the past. In 2018, anthropologist Lauri Travis, at Carroll College at the time, teamed up with student Hannah Decker to see if Dax, a then 12-week-old border collie and Australian shepherd mix, could be trained to detect the bones of mammals that humans hunted and consumed in the past.
 “I want to find out what Native peoples [in Montana] ate during two important droughts, one 8,000 years ago and one 2,000 years ago,” Travis explains. Dax could help.
  Decker spent much of her senior year of college training Dax (named after an intrepid  Star Trek character). “Dogs have always been a passion of mine, and I would not be who I am today without working with them,” she says.
 First indoors, then outside, Decker used real bones from nonhuman mammals, properly dated, in training exercises. In some cases, she used gloves to handle the samples to avoid any direct contact that might contaminate them. “I started by grinding bones into powdered dust, since that allows more surface area and more odor,” she explains.
 Decker paired bone dust with a toy and left it on the ground for Dax to discover. Later, she simply hid bone dust, and finally, she began to bury whole bones a few inches underground. Dax learned to signal that she had found something with a series of barks.
 By the time training ended, Dax could find bones buried 10 months earlier as deep as 6 inches. In one such experiment, she found animal bones that were more than 3,500 years old. By August 2019, the dog was finding complete mammal bones in the ground, and Travis reports that more recently, Dax found a 5,000-year-old bone that was buried 12 inches deep.
 Travis now cares for Dax full time. She works with the dog to identify archaeological sites of interest that could contain ancient mammal bones—from animals such as bison, deer, elk, or rabbit that may have been part of the diets of Indigenous peoples at the time. “We’re always looking for new tools to help us in our jobs, and I think scent dogs may prove really useful in the future,” Travis says.
 Picture it—a hardy, happy archaeology dog skidding across Montana’s snow and ice to sniff out the shards of an ancient ungulate from unimaginable eons ago.

关于如何在生活中取得成功，我们总是被骗：发现你最擅长的，努力工作，在财富和幸福的海洋中畅游。
如果你生来就是最擅长某件事的人，那就很管用了，但对其他人来说，这有点让人心碎。如果你没有任何世界级的技能怎么办？如果你对很多事情都很在行呢？
好消息是，几乎每个人都是这样的，包括超级成功的巨星。很少有成功人士真正在某件事上是最擅长的。它们通常是很多重要事物的有效组合。
比尔·盖茨不是世界上最好的程序员，也不是世界上最伟大的演说家、推销员、有远见的人或会计师。不过，他在这些事情上做得足够好，而且他已经学会了将自己的技能融合在一起，创造出更有价值的东西。
威尔·史密斯并不自称是世界上最伟大的演员或音乐家。但他将这些技能结合在一起，结合了迷人的个性，精明的个人品牌，以及顽强的工作道德。他的整体远远大于他的部分。
如果大多数这样的人只专注于他们“最擅长”的一项技能，他们可能会犯下可怕的错误。史蒂夫·乔布斯可能会成为一名二手车推销员。
即使你的技能平庸，平庸的巧妙结合也能把你变成无价之宝。
假设你是一个还过得去的网球运动员。你热爱这项运动，但你知道你永远不会成为世界冠军。就其本身而言，这项技能并不值钱。但是你要学会把这项技能和教得好的能力结合起来。之后，你会想出如何制作教学视频，以及如何在互联网上宣传自己。你不会在制作视频或在线推广方面做得最好，但即使把平庸的技能加在一起也是独一无二的。你可以做你喜欢做的事情，建立一个欣欣向荣的在线业务，但你所有的个人技能永远不会超越“好东西”。
这对任何职业都适用。一个懂一点法律、肢体语言、编程、设计或公开演讲的普通商人，可以断言比他们的同龄人具有巨大的优势。事实上，你可能会说，让一个人成为伟大的商人是相关技能的融合，比如心理学和自律。
个人技能是常见的。组合比较罕见。如果你想提升你的价值，就从你的长处后退一步，并考虑建立更广泛的强项组合。

We’re forever being sold a lie on how to prosper in life: discover what you’re best at, work hard at it, swim in an ocean of riches and happiness.
 That works brilliantly if you were born the best at something, but for everyone else, it’s kinda soul-crushing. What if you don’t have any world class skills? What if you’re just ok at lots of things?
 The good news is, nearly everybody is like this, and that includes ultra-successful megastars. Very few successful people are actually the best at something. They’re usually a really effective mix of lots of things that matter.
 Bill Gates is not the best programmer in the world, nor is he the world’s greatest speaker, salesperson, visionary or accountant. He’s  good enough at these things though, and he’s learnt to weld his skills together into something far more valuable.
 Will Smith doesn’t claim to be the world’s greatest actor or musician. But he’s coupled these skills  together, combined with a charming personality, shrewd personal branding, and a die-hard work ethic. His whole is far greater than his parts.
 Most such people would have made a terrible mistake had they solely focussed on the one skill they were ‘best’ at. Steve Jobs might have become a used car salesman.
 Even when your skills are mediocre, an astute combination of mediocrity can turn you into something priceless.
 Say you’re a passable tennis player. You love the game, but you know you’ll never be a world champion. By itself, this skill isn’t worth much. But you learn to combine that skill with the ability to teach well. Later, you figure out how to make tuition videos, and how to promote yourself on the Internet. You won’t be the  best at making videos, or online-promotion, but even mediocre skills combined are unique. You could build a thriving online business  doing what you love and yet all your individual skills never advanced beyond ‘good-ish’.
 This works for any profession. An average businessperson who learns a bit of law, or body language, or programming, or design, or public speaking can assert a monumental advantage over their peers. Indeed, you might say what makes someone a  great businessperson is a fusion of relevant skills, like psychology and self-discipline.
 Individual skills are common. Combinations are rarer. If you want to raise your value, take a step back from your strengths, and consider building a broader combination of them.

每个TRISO粒子都由铀、碳和氧燃料核组成。内核由三层碳基和陶瓷基材料包裹，可以防止放射性裂变产物的释放。

TRISO燃料在结构上比传统反应堆燃料更耐中子辐照、腐蚀、氧化和高温(这些因素对燃料性能影响最大)。
多亏了它的三层涂层，每个粒子都充当了它自己的遏制系统。这使得它们可以在所有反应堆条件下保留裂变产物。
简而言之，Triso粒子不能在反应堆中熔化，可以承受远远超过当前核燃料门槛的极端温度。
TRISO燃料最早是在20世纪60年代由美国和英国用二氧化铀燃料开发的。为了进一步发展先进的高温气体反应堆，美国能源部于2002年将重点放在了利用氧化碳化铀燃料核改进TRISO燃料，提高其辐照性能和制造方法上。
2009年，这种改进的TRISO燃料在爱达荷州国家实验室(INL)进行的为期三年的测试中达到了19%的最大燃耗，创造了一项国际纪录。这几乎是德国人在20世纪80年代创下的上一次纪录的两倍，是目前轻水燃料所能达到的燃耗的三倍-这表明了它的长寿命能力。
然后，将辐照后的燃料在1800摄氏度(超过3000华氏度)的温度下进行300多个小时的测试。这些测试超出了高温气体反应堆预计的最坏事故条件，并显示完全保留裂变产物的粒子没有受到甚至最小程度的损害。
INL目前正在继续进行TRISO燃料合格测试。在能源部的支持下，电力研究所与INL和行业利益相关者合作，向美国核管理委员会(NRC)提交了一份安全许可专题报告，供官方审查。未来的测试结果将提交给NRC，以获得TRISO燃料和反应堆供应商的许可。
TRISO燃料测试正受到先进反应堆社区的极大关注。一些反应堆供应商，如X-Energy和Kairos Power，以及国防部，正计划在他们的设计中使用TRISO燃料-包括一些小型模块化和微型反应堆的概念。
能源部还支持X-Energy为新制造设施设计和提交NRC许可证申请的努力。该项目最终将使用高含量、低浓缩铀来生产Triso燃料颗粒和卵石，用于未来的高温气体和熔盐反应堆。
TRISO燃料研究通过核能办公室的先进反应堆技术(ART)计划得到支持。ART赞助与大学和行业合作伙伴的合作努力，以加快各种先进反应堆设计的研究。
note_en:
More than 70 projects are underway in the United States with new designs that are expected to be more economical to build and operate.
 Some of them will require a new fuel that’s tough enough handle the higher operating temperatures of these advanced reactors.
    Each TRISO particle is made up of a uranium, carbon and oxygen fuel kernel. The kernel is encapsulated by three layers of carbon- and ceramic-based materials that prevent the release of radioactive fission products.
 The particles are incredibly small (about the size of a poppy seed) and very robust.
 They can be fabricated into cylindrical pellets or billiard ball-sized spheres called “pebbles” for use in either high temperature gas or molten salt-cooled reactors.
 TRISO fuels are structurally more resistant to neutron irradiation, corrosion, oxidation and high temperatures (the factors that most impact fuel performance) than traditional reactor fuels.
 Each particle acts as its own containment system thanks to its triple-coated layers. This allows them to retain fission products under all reactor conditions.
 Simply put,  TRISO particles cannot melt in a reactor and can withstand extreme temperatures that are well beyond the threshold of current nuclear fuels.
    TRISO fuel was first developed in the United States and United Kingdom in the 1960s with uranium dioxide fuel. In 2002, the Department of Energy (DOE) focused on improving TRISO fuel using uranium oxicarbide fuel kernels and enhancing its irradiation performance and manufacturing methods in order to further develop advanced high-temperature gas reactors.
 In 2009, this improved TRISO fuel set an  international record by achieving a 19% maximum burnup during a three-year test at Idaho National Laboratory (INL). This is nearly double the previous mark set by the Germans in the 1980s and is three times the burnup that current light-water fuels can achieve—demonstrating its long-life capability.
 The irradiated fuel was then exposed to more than 300 hours of testing at temperatures up to 1800° Celsius (more than 3,000° Fahrenheit).  These tests exceeded the predicted worst-case accident conditions for high-temperature gas reactors and showed  no to minimal damage of the particles with full fission product retention.
 Continued TRISO fuel qualification testing is currently underway at INL. With support from DOE, the Electric Power Research Institute worked with INL and industry stakeholders to submit a  licensing topical report to the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) for official review. Future test results will be submitted to the NRC for licensing TRISO fuel and reactor vendors.
  TRISO fuel testing is gaining a lot of interest from the advanced reactor community. Some reactor vendors such as  X-energy and  Kairos Power, along with the Department of Defense, are planning to use TRISO fuel for their designs—including some small modular and micro-reactor concepts.
 DOE is also  supporting X-energy’s efforts to design and submit a NRC license application for a new fabrication facility. The project would ultimately use high assay low enriched uranium to produce the TRISO fuel pellets and pebbles for future high-temperature gas and molten salt reactors.
  TRISO fuel research is supported through the Office of Nuclear Energy’s  Advanced Reactor Technologies (ART) program. ART sponsors collaborative efforts with universities and industry partners to accelerate research on various advanced reactor designs.

Backing the company, which counts the Ethereum network and a number of other “DeFi” projects as competitors, is London-based seed-stage VC LocalGlobe and TransferWise co-founder Taavet Hinrikus.
 Radix DLT Ltd. — separate from the non-profit Radix Foundation — had previously raised $1.9 million in equity funding in the form of a SAFE note and will be issued 2.4 billion tokens by the Radix Foundation (see below).
  In its own words, Radix DLT is building a decentralised finance protocol that aims to provide “frictionless access, liquidity and programmability of any asset in the world”. The Radix team also claims it has overcome the scalability issue that typically plagues decentralised finance and blockchain-based ledgers.
 In a public test of the Radix network last year, it claims to have achieved over 1 million transactions per second, a throughput over 5x higher than the NASDAQ at its peak.
 It also positions itself as different from other distributed ledgers and decentralised protocols. Radix is “not trying to be a general purpose platform,” says CEO Piers Ridyard. “Decentralised finance, and by extension, the financial industry is a highly specialised sector that requires a highly specialised set of tools and incentives. Unlike the general purpose protocols that came before it, such as Ethereum, Radix is building a layer 1 protocol specifically for decentralised finance”.
 Benefiting from over 7 years of R&D carried out by founder Dan Hughes, a self taught coder from the North of England, Ridyard says that Radix’s sole focus on DeFi from the get-go means Redix is lowering the barriers to adoption via integrations with payment rails and consumer applications, increasing on-ledger liquidity, and by making it as easy as possible for developers to build new DeFi apps. The latter consists of the Radix Engine, a developer interface that claims to enable quick public ledger deployments using a “secure-by-design” environment.
  At the highest level, proponents of so-called DeFi point to the fact that every system in finance is essentially built on its own, proprietary, non-compatible technology stack that still has far too many human processes behind it. For example, the London Stock Exchange, the U.S. NASDAQ, the Shanghai Stock Exchange are all built as “islands”. To trade across them requires centralised technology, protocol and legal integrations with each.
 “That is because finance, lending, borrowing, swapping, and issuance are all done in these little islands of technology that require legal contracts and excel spreadsheets sent over email as the connective tissue,” says Ridyard. “APIs are improving this process, but there is no such thing as a standard API; Plaid became a $5.3 billion company for essentially this reason”.
 By being decentralised and interoperable from day one, it’s this ability to trade across ledgers and asset classes programatically that DeFi systems such as Radix want to provide.
 “This is the core and key difference for assets and services that are built on public ledgers,” explains Ridyard. “As soon as they are built on Radix, they become interoperable. I can seamlessly and programmatically move my assets from the services of one application, built by one company and team, to that of another, built by a different company and team, but issued and launched on the same decentralised public ledger. The public ledger acts as an interoperable platform for many startups to experiment and build better versions of existing products (such as stock exchanges) or entirely new products (such as continuous function market makers) that are just not possible with the current systems”.
 Worth noting, Ridyard says that from a consumer point of view, the products and services aren’t likely to change much in their appearance — they’ll still be accessed via mobile apps and will probably be offered via regulated companies as they are today. Instead, he says the consumer-facing upsides will be speed, higher rates on deposits and the seamless ability to swap between asset types without needing to go into cash as the interim asset.
 Adds the Radix CEO: “I should also stress that decentralised finance is not about moving existing banks onto public ledgers. It is about unbundling of banking services (borrowing, lending, investment) into applications that can all interoperate on a single public network. Banks are like newspapers coming into the internet age, some will make the transition, but not all”.
 Cue statement from LocalGlobe’s Saul Klein (for posterity, if nothing else): “I see the same revolutionary potential in the Radix team as I did with the Skype and Netscape teams at the birth of the internet. We’re excited to join them at the start of a new decentralised network revolution”.
 *Radix has two main legal entities: Radix DLT Ltd and the Radix Foundation. Since inception, both have received funding in different forms. The Radix Foundation is a not-for-profit company limited by guarantee, registered in the U.K., and was created to promote the long term interests of the Radix Public Network as well as help manage the Radix community and ecosystem. Between 2013 and 2017, people from the Radix Community contributed 3,000 BTC in exchange for 3 billion RADIX tokens issued by the Radix Foundation. These tokens arguably have value as they’re needed to pay the transaction fees to use the Radix protocol.

阿扬达资本(Ayanda Capital)向NHS提供2.5亿GB个人防护用品的合同并没有引起应有的轰动，因为英国公民似乎已经开始接受我们生活在一个拥有香蕉共和国资本主义制度的国家。我想，当一位首相拿出6000万GB的公款建造一座花园大桥时，根本没有机会建造，而且他毫不犹豫地将公款交给他众多情妇中的一个，那么规范就改变了。
阿扬达资本(Ayanda Capital)自称是一家“家族理财室”。它基本上是为霍里克家族的私人财富进行投资和金融工程，包括避税。“家族理财室”在伦敦金融城有一个非常具体的含义。我能找到的最简单的定义是：
家族理财室是服务于超高净值(UHNW)投资者的私人财富管理咨询公司。它们与传统的财富管理商店的不同之处在于，它们提供了一种完全外包的解决方案，以管理富裕个人或家庭的财务和投资方面。
有时，家族理财室投资的是不止一个“非常高净值”个人或家族的财富，但它们不会向更广泛的公众或机构投资或筹集资金。
Ayanda Capital唯一被指名为“拥有重大控制权”的人是蒂莫西·皮尔斯·霍里克(Timothy Piers Horlick)，但他通过一家毛里求斯公司拥有该公司。毛里求斯现在是一个臭名昭著的避税天堂；它提供零税收，并对公司高管和所有者保密。
我们没有理由认为阿扬达资本(Ayanda Capital)在私人财富管理领域的活动是非法的，也没有理由认为这是晚期资本主义令人讨厌的趋势的一部分，即资本资产超级集中到私人手中，远离传统的更分散的机构和股东所有权形式。阿扬达的做法从其网站上看已经很清楚了：
正如你从这份简介中所预期的那样，Ayanda Capital本身，而不是它投资的财富，只不过是一家空壳公司。它有两位导演，内森·菲利普·恩格尔布雷希特和蒂莫西·皮尔斯·霍里克。事实上，2019年12月，阿扬达资本的资产负债表显示，仅靠价值289万GB的“无形资产”才保住了免于破产的命运。这几乎正好是那些“无形资产”价值在12个月内增加了200万GB，据称是由于这一数额的“开发”支出。正在开发的是什么完全不清楚。很难想象一家私人财富投资公司如何开发价值近300万GB的某种形式的无形资产。我发现，这一切很难不仅仅是会计上的喘息-而且是一种相当苍白的喘息。
到目前为止，并不引人注目。所以问题是这样的。为什么NHS会求助于这个道德肮脏但具有时代精神的平庸的私人财富管理办公室，向NHS提供价值2.5亿英镑的个人防护用品(PPE)？“财富管理”杂志对这篇报道做了出色的报道，他们的合同是只提供口罩。他们证实了一个令人震惊的事实，即没有公布对这份25亿英镑合同的投标。今年3月，通过威斯敏斯特对新冠肺炎危机的二级立法，正常的招标程序被暂停。
正常的公共采购招标程序有公司必须符合的资格预审标准。这些条件通常包括在特定行业多年的经验、聘用合资格的员工、拥有所需的实体基础设施，以及一定程度的财政稳定。这可能是显而易见的-否则，你或我可以简单地坚持投标，建造比任何人都便宜100亿GB的HS2铁路，赢得合同，然后去寻找建筑商。
Ayanda Capital将无法通过向NHS供应PPE的正常采购标准中的每一项测试。除了去看牙医，我看不到任何证据表明公司里有人见过个人防护用品。他们似乎没有医疗专业知识，没有建立的医疗采购网络，没有质量控制检验能力，没有海外发货代理，没有仓储或物流设施。当然，我们以前从这些狡猾的保守党人那里看到过这种情况，他们的“紧急采购”，以及没有渡轮的“渡轮公司”。但这-25亿英镑-是在一个完全不同的水平上。
我理解正常的采购链在苦苦挣扎，但我仍然相信，英国众多历史悠久、在全球取得成功的医疗供应公司中的任何一家，都会走出去，获得合适种类、合适质量的医疗用品，并安排供应和交付，而不是把纳税人的一大笔钱扔给第一对说他们可以做到的全城男孩。来自一家资产负债表非常不可靠的公司。
在这笔交易中，除了经典的香蕉共和国“先生10%”之外，Ayanda Capital还有什么？英国究竟变成了一个什么样的国家？难怪它要分崩离析了。
与我们的对手不同，包括诚信倡议(Integrity Initiative)、第77旅、贝灵猫(Bellingcat)、大西洋理事会(Atlantic Council)和数百个其他好战的宣传活动，这个博客没有任何国家、企业或机构资金来源。它完全依靠读者的自愿订阅-其中许多人不一定同意每一篇文章的观点，但欢迎另一种声音、内幕信息和辩论。

The Ayanda Capital contract to supply £250 million of PPE to the NHS has not caused anything like the stir it should, because UK citizens appear to have come to accept that we live in a country with a Banana Republic system of capitalism. I suppose when you have a Prime Minister who handed out £60 million of public money for a Garden Bridge that there was no chance would ever be built, and who had no qualms about directing public funds to one of his many mistresses, the norm has changed.
  Ayanda Capital self-describes as a “family office”. It essentially carries out investment and financial engineering, including tax avoidance, for the private wealth of the Horlick family. “Family office” has a very specific meaning in the City of London. The best simple definition I could find  is here:
 Family offices are private wealth management advisory firms that serve ultra-high-net-worth (UHNW) investors. They are different from traditional wealth management shops in that they offer a total outsourced solution to managing the financial and investment side of an affluent individual or family.
 Sometimes family offices invest the wealth of more than one “very high net worth” individual or family, but they do not invest or raise funds from the wider public or from institutions.
 The only named “person with significant control” of Ayanda Capital is Timothy Piers Horlick, but he owns it through a Mauritius company. Mauritius is now a notorious  tax haven; it offers zero tax and keeps company officers and owners secret.
  There is no reason to suppose that the activities of Ayanda Capital in private wealth management were illegal, or any more than part of the execrable trend of late stage capitalism towards super concentration of capital assets into private hands and away from the traditional more distributed forms of institutional and shareholder ownership. What Ayanda does is plain enough from its website:
   As you would expect from that profile, Ayanda Capital itself, rather than the wealth it invests, is little more than a shell company. It has two directors, Nathan Philip Engelbrecht and Timothy Piers Horlick. In fact, in December 2019,  Ayanda Capital’s balance sheet shows that it was only kept from bankruptcy by “intangible assets” worth £2,890,000. That was an increase of almost exactly £2,000,000 in the value of those “intangible assets”  in twelve months, allegedly due to “development” spending of that amount. What was being developed is entirely unclear. It is difficult to see how a private wealth investment company develops some form of intangible asset with a value of nearly £3 million. I find it hard to see all that as more than an accounting wheeze – and a rather hoary one at that.
  So far, so unremarkable. So the question is this. Why would the NHS turn to this ethically sordid but zeitgeist banal private wealth management office to provide a quarter of a billion pounds worth of PPE to the NHS? Wealth Manager magazine, who have done  excellent journalism on this story, have the contract as supplying only face masks. They have confirmed the astonishing fact that there was  no published tender for the quarter billion pound contract. Normal tendering processes were suspended in March through secondary legislation at Westminster for the Covid-19 Crisis.
  The normal public procurement tendering process has pre-qualification criteria which companies have to meet. These will normally include so many years of experience in the specific sector, employment of suitably qualified staff, possession of the required physical infrastructure and a measure of financial stability. This is perhaps obvious – otherwise you or I could simply stick in a bid to build the HS2 railway that is £10 billion cheaper than anybody else, win the contract then go and look for a builder.
 Ayanda Capital would fail every single test in normal procurement criteria to supply PPE to the NHS. I can see no evidence that anybody in the company had ever seen PPE except when visiting the dentist. They appear to have no medical expertise, no established medical procurement network, no quality control inspection ability, no overseas shipment agents, no warehousing or logistics facilities. We have of course seen this before from these crooked Tories with their “emergency procurement”, with the “ferry company”  with no ferries. But this – a quarter of a billion pounds – is on a whole different level.
 I understand that normal procurement chains were struggling, but I would still trust any of the UK’s numerous long established and globally successful medical supply companies to go out and get the right kind of medical supplies, of the right quality, and arrange their supply and delivery, rather than throw an incredible sum of taxpayers’ cash at the first couple of City wide boys who said they can do it. From a company with a very dodgy balance sheet.
 What are Ayanda Capital in this transaction other than the classic Banana Republic “Mr 10%”? Precisely what kind of country has the UK become? No wonder it is falling apart.

GitHub本周向开发者推送了一种新的设计方案&存储库主页--但很多人只想要回旧的界面。
根据GitHub的说法，存储库主页的通用UI刷新提供了更具响应性的布局和改进的移动Web体验。存储库侧栏中还有更多内容，您现在可以在其中显示或隐藏版本、包和环境。
GitHub目前还没有黑暗模式，但根据微软旗下网站的说法，它即将到来。
但开发人员对新设计反应愤怒，一些人要求提供恢复到旧UI的选项，就像GitHub用户在预览新UI时可以做的那样。
新的用户界面在功能预览中出现了一段时间，用户可以选择退出。现在，新的UI已被强制用于我的帐户(以及其他所有人？)。而且没有选择退出的选项(或者至少不容易找到按钮)。Yashassamaga在GitHub的社区论坛上写道，如何恢复UI更改？
新的用户界面遍布整个屏幕。旧的用户界面要简洁得多。UI中的一些新元素似乎并不像存储库主页中的贡献者列表那样有用。数字和标签的字体也太锐利/轻巧了。&#34；
用户界面的改变经常会引起用户的震惊和愤怒，特别是在他们的早期，所以这对GitHub来说可能会烟消云散。然而，许多用户似乎对这些变化深感恼火。
现在已经有了Old School GitHub的Chrome扩展和开发人员Dean Attali提供的Firefox插件，它可以让不喜欢新外观的用户将部分新的存储库页面设计还原为旧的页面设计。
其中，Attali&#39；的扩展功能将标题移到原来的位置，带回经典的GitHub按钮(他认为这些按钮看起来比新按钮更容易点击)，并将新的圆形头像与旧的正方形头像交换。
目前有60多份对原始投诉的回复，只有一名用户赞成新设计，而其余的用户则要求使用旧UI的选项。对GitHub来说，积极的一面是，对重新设计的不满本可以帮助建立GitHub社区。
一位用户写道，就像我之前的许多人一样，我也刚刚创建了一个支持账户，加入了希望找回旧UI的人的名单中。
昨天我在做我的项目，突然UI变了。起初，我以为我看错了页面，还以为我不小心登陆了GitLab。我喜欢GitHub的一个方面是它的特殊和易于设计。当我意识到这可能不是一个糟糕的笑话后，我立即失去了那天做项目的打算，沮丧地离开了。
GitHub的一名员工已经回复了这条帖子，并表示用户的反馈将与GitHub的产品和工程团队分享。
感谢您就最近的UI更改分享您的观点、挫折和建议。目前，没有任何方法可以选择退出更新后的UI。GitHub的员工写道：我们非常感谢这些反馈，我们也在与我们的产品和工程团队分享这些反馈。
GitHub首席执行官纳特·弗里德曼(Nat Friedman)在回应黑客新闻(Hacker News)的投诉时表示，重新设计是一项正在进行的工作。
一位用户认为，GitHub的变化跟随着UI中信息密度降低的趋势。
弗里德曼说：我不认为这里有降低信息密度的原则。我认为这只是一个我们会不断重复的设计。我们支持GitHub的信息密度。
但许多评论者感到恼火的是，GitHub似乎在没有听取参与预览的人的反馈的情况下就推动了重新设计。
note_en:
GitHub has this week pushed a new design on to developers' repository homepages – but many people just want the old interface back.
 According to GitHub, the general UI refresh to the home page of repositories provides a more responsive layout and an improved mobile web experience. There is also more content in the repository side bar, where you can now show or hide Releases, Packages, and Environments.
    GitHub doesn't have dark mode yet, but according to the Microsoft-owned site, it is coming.
  But developers have reacted angrily to the new design, with some demanding an option to revert to the old UI as GitHub users could when the new UI was in preview.
   "A new UI was in the feature preview for a while and users could opt out. Now the new UI has been forced on my account (and everyone else?) and there is no option to opt out (or at least it's not easy to find the button). How do I revert the UI change?,"  wrote yashassamaga on GitHub's community forum.
 "The new UI spreads across the whole screen. The old UI [was] much more concise. Some of the new elements in the UI don't seem to be useful like the list of contributors in a repository main page. The font of the numbers and labels [is] also too sharp/light and tiny."
   UI changes frequently cause shock and anger among users, especially in their early days, so this could blow over for GitHub. However, many users seem deeply annoyed by the changes.
 Already there's an 'Old School GitHub'  Chrome extension and a Firefox add-on from developer Dean Attali, which lets users who dislike the new look revert parts of the new repository page design to the old one.
 Among other things, Attali's extension moves the headers to their original place, brings back classic GitHub buttons – which he thinks look more clickable than the new buttons – and switches the new circular avatar with the old square one.
 There are currently over 60 responses to the original complaint, and only one user is in favor of the new design, while the remainder are demanding an option to use the old UI. On a positive note for GitHub, displeasure with the redesign could have helped build the GitHub Community.
 "Like many others before me, I also just created a support account to join the list of people who want the old UI back,"  wrote one user.
 "Yesterday I was working on my projects and suddenly the UI changed. At first I thought I am on the wrong page and thought I accidentally landed on GitLab. One of the aspects I loved GitHub for was its special and easy to work with design. After I realized that this might not be a bad joke, I immediately lost my intention to work on my projects that day and quitted frustrated."
 A GitHub employee has responded to the thread and says the users' feedback will be shared with GitHub's product and engineering teams.
 "Thank you kindly for sharing your perspectives, frustrations and suggestions on the recent UI changes. Presently, there is no method to opt out of the updated UI. We absolutely appreciate the feedback and we are also sharing this feedback with our product and engineering teams,"  wrote the GitHub employee.
  GitHub CEO Nat Friedman suggested the redesign was a work in progress when  responding to complaints on Hacker News.
 One user thinks GitHub's changes are following the trend of lowering "information density" in UIs.
 "I don't think there is a principle of lowering information density at work here," said Friedman. "I think it's just a design that we will keep iterating. We are pro information density at GitHub."
 But many of those commenting are annoyed that GitHub seems to have pushed through the redesign without listening to feedback from people who participated in the preview.

自1988年由Leonardo Chiariglione和Hiroshi Yasuda(来自日本电报和电话公司)成立以来，运动图像专家组(MPEG)在从模拟视频到数字视频的过渡中留下了不可磨灭的印记。根据Chiariglione的数据，在全球范围内，依赖MPEG标准的产品和服务的年价值约为1.5万亿美元，约占世界生产总值的2%。当然，没有人可能怀疑MPEG创建的视频编解码器在娱乐和商业领域新冠肺炎危机期间所发挥的令人难以置信的价值。
2020年6月6日，图1所示的消息出现在Chiariglione的MPEG网站上，宣布MPEG关闭。稍微挖掘一下就会发现，虽然Chiariglione实际上已经与MPEG分离，但MPEG实际上并没有关闭，尽管它进行了重大重组。尽管如此，如果为那些对数字视频的成功做出贡献的人有一座拉什莫尔山，Chiariglione显然会有一个半身像，这使得他与MPEG的分手足够重要，足以值得纪念。
因此，在这个故事中，我们将做三件事。首先，我们会告诉你发生了什么事。然后，我们将分享我们对Chiariglione与MPEG的分离将产生的影响的看法。第三，一旦我们了解到Chiariglione的离别，我们请读者对他和MPEG对数字视频的贡献发表一些看法。只有几位读者做出了贡献，但我们将在下面分享他们的想法。
作为背景，MPEG是为我们带来MPEG-1、MPEG-2、H.264和HEVC的标准制定组织，通用视频编码(VVC)、基本视频编码(EVC)和低复杂度增强视频编码(LCEVC)将于2020年推出。从技术上讲，MPEG在国际标准化组织(ISO)下运作。从组织的角度来看，ISO运行多个技术委员会，如图2顶部所示的IT联合委员会或JTC1。JTC1下面是多个小组委员会，如小组委员会29，负责音频、图片、多个和超媒体信息的编码(SC 29)。
SC 29下有多个工作组，包括JPEG第1工作组(由于空间原因没有显示)和MPEG第11工作组，该工作组在6月6日之前由Chiariglione运营。每个工作组下面是子组，包括图2中显示的具有各自功能的子组。
在6月6日重组后，前两个位置保持不变，但工作组11似乎被淘汰了，许多以前的小组被推上工作组(WG)的地位，如图3所示，我从2020年6月4日在线举行的SC29次全体会议的决议中得出了这个新的结构。根据从加里·沙利文那里收到的一张纸条，请注意，MPEG协调小组可能会扮演协调MPEG工作的主要角色，而不是SC29本身。
请注意，决议中的所有工作组和顾问组的前缀都是MPEG，为了节省空间，我从组织结构图中删除了MPEG。因此，本文将音频编码工作组称为MPEG音频编码工作组，保留了MPEG名称。在一份日期为6月24日的公告中，ISO表示，重组将于2020年7月17日生效。
如图3所示，SC 29还选择了前述微软员工、JCT-VC小组前联席主席Gary Sullivan博士，在2020年接替铃木泰彦担任小组主席。根据“重新思考研究”(Reink Research)的一篇文章(需要订阅)，我们了解到，基亚里格利奥尼获得了一系列荣誉职位，但遭到了拒绝，显然认为这是对他诚信的侮辱，因为这些职位实际上是无能为力的。因此，Chiariglione突然从ISO辞职，并宣布MPEG的死亡是他的麦克风下降时刻。
因此，我们改变了组织结构，更换了领导层。那是什么意思？关于结构，Chiariglione在重组前后的多篇文章中分享了他的想法。特别是他在2018年2月的一篇文章中发表的评论，在上面图2详细描述了MPEG的组织结构后，Chiariglione表示：MPEG能否克服视频危机？？在上面的图2中详细描述了MPEG的组织结构后，Chiariglione表示：
[MPEG]可能是ISO中唯一的组织，但它之所以存在，是因为媒体系统的标准需要其组件之间的强交互。正因为如此，MPEG举行了几次联席会议，相关小组讨论并就共同感兴趣的问题达成一致。开发复杂数字媒体标准的能力是MPEG标准在市场上取得成功的原因之一。分解MPEG将对创建有效标准的能力造成致命打击。
换句话说，让多个子组在一位经理的领导下一起工作是很有意义的，尽管本质上这也是我们在重组后看到的情况。Chiariglione在重组后写的其他文章明确表示，他也觉得ISO结构虚伪、混乱和封建，标准最好像MPEG过去那样自下而上(由成员制定)，而不是他声称ISO有效的自上而下(由国家标准机构制定)。老实说，我对ISO和MPEG是如何发挥作用来评估这些声明的了解还不够，但它们是一本有趣的读物。
这对于2020年发布的MPEG视频编解码器VVC、EVC和LCEVC意味着什么？正如“重新思考研究”一文中所说，预计今年推出的三个新的MPEG标准-JVET VVC、MPEG-5 Part 1 EVC和MPEG-5 Part 2 LCEVC在技术基础上不会有太大变化。这三个标准都是ISO/IEC标准，而且三个标准在技术上都已经完成，所以ISO SC29的组织变化应该只会影响未来的ISO/MPEG标准，而不会影响已经完成的MPEG标准。当然，业界对这三个新兴标准的采用将取决于技术优势、易实施性和商业案例，而不是新的ISO SC29说了什么或做了什么。
Chiariglione不愿直接对这篇文章发表评论，但在他的许多文章中已经清楚地表达了他的想法。回顾MPEG在没有MPEG的未来中取得的成功，他写道，MPEG已经赌博了30年，有时赢，有时输。显然，他认为MPEG-2和AVC/H.264是成功的，他写道，MPEG LA开发了MPEG-2视频许可证。MPEG-2被广泛使用，MPEG-4 AVC是一个非常成功的标准，它可以自豪地承载通用属性，因为它也用于广播和在线流媒体。
另一方面，HEVC是亏损的，至少在流媒体方面是这样。在同一篇文章中，Chiariglione写道，7年后，MPEG-H HEVC专利持有者无法团结一致，提出一个体面的统一许可。然而，HEVC在广播领域的应用充其量也是有限的。他写道：“最后，大家终于意识到，旧的MPEG商业模式已经破灭，业界为新视频编解码器所做的所有投资(总计数亿美元)都将化为乌有，AOM的免版税模式也将扩展到其他业务领域。”他还写道，HEVC在流媒体方面的使用充其量也是有限的。他写道：终于，每个人都意识到，旧的MPEG商业模式现在已经破灭，而AOM的免版税模式也将蔓延到其他业务领域。
很明显，Chiariglione认为AOM是MPEG的一个重要竞争对手，他预测如果AV1作为一个免版税的编解码器获得成功，视频编解码器和视频编解码器开发者将会有一个反乌托邦的未来。在“没有MPEG的未来”一书中，他写道，HEVC留下的空白已被AOM广泛用于流媒体的AV1规范所填补。
在危机、原因和解决方案中，他继续说，AOM肯定会给视频编解码器市场带来亟需的稳定，但这将以减少(如果不是完全停止)技术进步为代价。公司将完全没有动力开发新的视频压缩技术，由于该领域的复杂性，公司将花费非常大的成本开发新的视频压缩技术，因为他们知道，他们的资产将被AOM在其视频编解码器中接受和使用，这是令人欣慰的--仅此而已。
他继续讲述如何处理一台卡住的机器？新的未来将是成千上万个高薪的媒体压缩工作和支持它的学术研究的未来，因为对新的压缩技术的迫切需求不再存在。
当然，由于Chiariglione撰写了这篇文章，Sisvel推出了AV1和VP9的专利池，所以AV1&#39；的免版税地位肯定是有疑问的。尽管如此，这并没有削弱AOM作为MPEG和创建编解码器的MPEG方式的主要竞争对手的作用。(全面披露：作者正在与Sisvel就这些池进行咨询。)。
总而言之，在MPEG-2和AVC大获成功之后，Chiariglione认为MPEG在HEVC上跌跌撞撞，现在面临着AOM的主要竞争对手，部分原因是HEVC的许可问题。有了这样的背景，就不难理解为什么SC29&#39；决定从根本上用加里·沙利文(Gary Sullivan)取代奇亚里奥尼。加里·沙利文受雇于微软(Microsoft)，后者是AOM的主要竞争对手之一，其成员一直在压制HEVC的部署。
例如，Mozilla和Google都是AOM的创始成员，而HEVC仍然不能在各自的浏览器中播放，即使在安装了HEVC硬件解码器的系统上也不能播放(图4)。两家公司都可以很容易地利用支持的平台上提供的现有硬件或软件HEVC解码，而不会招致版税，因为这就是Mozilla支持H.264播放的方式，首先使用主机系统上提供的基于硬件的解码器，然后使用Cisco OpenH.264二进制模块。Chrome不支持Android上的HEVC播放，尽管Android操作系统支持软件中的HEVC播放。
请注意，尽管图4中显示的CanIUse数据表明Edge不能播放HEVC，但我在运行Windows10的HP Zbook上尝试了Edge中的HEVC播放，它工作得很好。然而，对于Chrome或Firefox来说，情况并非如此。
图4.AOM成员Mozilla(Firefox)和Google(Chrome)仍然不支持在他们的浏览器中播放HEVC。
可以肯定的是，微软是一家大公司，标准和编解码器开发充斥着宿敌、合作竞争和奇怪的伙伴。例如，苹果拥有MPEG LA HEVC专利池的专利，但却成为AOM的创始成员(AOM推出27个月后)。BBC拥有同一批专利，也是AOM的(非创始)成员。
尽管如此，在微软雷蒙德园区的某个地方，显然有员工希望MPEG能干脆消失，而沙利文的升迁，尽管他的资历令人印象深刻，无懈可击，但从外部看，就像是让狐狸来掌管鸡舍。
我向基亚里奥尼询问了这一明显的利益冲突，他回答说，无可奉告。但他确实表示，向SC 29征集候选人的请求表明，这个高级中性国际标准职位的候选人必须避免偏见，甚至避免出现利益冲突。作为一个客观的局外人，沙利文似乎不符合这一标准，或许这在一定程度上解释了基亚里奥尼&。
所以，我们可能已经解释了Chiariglione的敌意，但这对MPEG将于2020年推出的三种编解码器的成功意味着什么-通用视频编码(VVC)、基本视频编码(EVC)和低复杂度增强视频编码(LCEVC)？正如我在MPEG‘s雄心勃勃的计划在2020年推出3个编解码器中所解释的那样，MPEG似乎对这些编解码器有三个目标。首先，简化知识产权图景(并避免另一场HEVC的纠葛)。第二，提供一个免版税的替代方案来对抗AOM和AV1。第三，提供CPU友好的替代方案，以避免新编解码器所需的繁琐计算复杂度。
VVC几乎在这些目标形成之前就完全诞生了，是HEVC的自然继承者。根据Chiriaglione的说法，VVC专利持有者的数量最有可能比HEVC的数量多得多，使得VVC在本质上是另一个等待发生的HEVC。然而，除了ISO和MPEG之外，媒体编码行业论坛成立于2018年，部分原因是为了提供一个论坛，并鼓励讨论与部署和使用这些标准相关的知识产权许可问题，以促进这一目的。
虽然VVC和MC-IF的陪审团还没有出来，但Chiriaglione并不乐观。谈到VVC和MC-如果在没有MPEG的未来，他说，然而，到目前为止，如果我们撇开在会议上组织的活动不谈，外部还没有具体的结果。MC-IF有31个成员，其中7个是许可实体(即略低于所有成员的1/4)。行业成员仅占HEVC专利持有者的1/2。在这种情况下，很难相信VVC的表现会好于HEVC。情况很可能会更糟，因为VVC在广播中的采用将需要数年时间，如果有的话。
接下来来看第二个编解码器，EVC有两个配置文件：第一个据称是免版税的，第二个是四家公司的专利，这应该会大大简化许可情况。关于EVC，Chiariglione说EVC是很有前途的，因为它提供了与AV1相当或更好的质量，尽管低于VVC。如果许可证将被公布，EVC可能会有机会。然而，这还没有发生。
最后，LCEVC是一种复杂度较低的替代方案，可以完全在软件中实现，因此是三种编解码器中唯一可能在2020年产生影响的编解码器。据报道，LCEVC的知识产权几乎完全归V-Nova所有，这也大大简化了许可情况。关于LCEVC，Chiariglione评论说，LCEVC一个像样的许可证可能是游戏规则的改变者，也是VVC面临的另一个威胁，这可能意味着VVC专利持有者面临额外的压力，要求他们提供一个像样的许可证。
回到VVC，Chiariglione总结道，EVC的成功可以帮助VVC取得成功。看到EVC(和AV1)的威胁，VVC专利持有者可以齐心协力，提供像样的许可。虽然我欢迎这样的发展，但我认为可能性很小。
南加州大学对这一切的看法是什么？我问了沙利文两个问题，一个是关于潜在的利益冲突，另一个是关于MPEG是否计划采取未来的措施来改善其编解码器的许可状态。他没有回复任何人，尽管这是假期前的一周(7月4日)，他说MPEG正在开会。如果他真的回复了，我们会在文章末尾贴出他的回复。
因此，我们所拥有的就是ISO&#39；本新闻稿中的声明，即SC 29遗憾地获悉SC 29/WG 11(MPEG)的前召集人莱昂纳多·基亚里格利奥内博士辞职，并对他三十多年来在这方面的服务表示感谢。在此期间，MPEG已经成为世界范围内音频和视频编码以及媒体同步、呈现、存储和传输以及媒体编码和传送的其它方面的系统规范的卓越标准组织。
重复上面“重新思考研究”的话，业界对这三项新兴标准的采用将更多地取决于技术优势、易实施性和商业案例，而不是新的ISO标准说了什么或做了什么。我们对性能和许可的了解如此之多，以至于不可能预测这三种标准中的任何一种会否成功，尽管很难反驳基亚里戈尼的任何一个结论。
如果这次重组发生在十年前，在AVC声名鹊起的时候，平稳的接班就会得到保证。但HEVC的授权混乱给MPEG视频标准蒙上了一层阴影，而AV1则提供了一个亮丽的替代方案，即使西斯维尔的AV1池可能会证明，并不是所有闪闪发光的东西都是金子。至少在视频编解码器方面，MPEG不再是曾经那样无懈可击的巨石。另一方面，Chiariglione可能无法带领MPEG走出困境，因为他对ISO机器的抱怨太久了，以至于他的声音似乎已经听不到了。
显然，Chiariglione是一个乔布斯式的经理人，他从视频编解码器开发社区和他的离职中获得了突破性的成就，而当时他的组织需要很大。最大的问题是加里·沙利文到底是蒂姆·库克还是约翰·斯卡利。
我们询问了行业专家对Chiariglione的离开和MPEG的变化的见解和意见，我们在下面以略有编辑的形式介绍他们。
巨大，因为这是唯一涵盖音频、视频以及广播和OTT流的关联元数据压缩的标准。这是每年数万亿(美元)收入的来源，可能雇佣了数百万名员工。
未包含在ISO框架中的许可条款是一个痛点。在AVC中，业界与AVC联盟(商业团体)和MPEG行业论坛(技术团体)一起行动起来对抗Microsoft VC-1。在HEVC中什么都没有做，因此出现了问题。对于VVC来说，MC-IF[媒体编码产业论坛]是为了促进VVC授权而创建的，所以还是有一些希望的。
MPEG LA向运动图像专家组(MPEG)及其创始人Leonardo Chiariglione和Hiroshi Yasuda致敬，感谢他们引领世界进入数字媒体时代甚至更远。MPEG动员并激励了世界上最聪明的工程师，他们毫不妥协地关注质量和独立性，将其作为市场接受的途径，并让市场自由寻找出路，决心实现这一目标。
尽管MPEG的门槛很高，但它的成就更高。从这一愿景中产生了数字视频、音频、数据和系统授权，将世界的信息传递到家庭和电话。
MPEG LA为自己发挥了重要作用而感到自豪。在合理接触MPEG用户与合理回报MPEG发明者和激励MPEG发明者之间取得平衡，有助于将消费电子历史上使用最广泛的标准推向世界市场。市场的创造性能量释放出具有商业竞争力的、可互操作的新产业生态系统、以前难以想象的产品和无数就业机会，创造了数万亿美元的产品销售额、相互联系的国家、文化和个人，并提高了数十亿人的生活质量。
不要相信你读到的东西。但MPEG的大门没有关闭。只要它的基础雄厚，它的数据流动，它的工作将继续留下永恒的印记。
关于mpeg…的不幸消息。在IFE行业工作，对MPEG视频的需求非常普遍。从MPEG-1的早期开始，我们就一直依赖于编解码器的开发。航空公司从90年代初开始使用靠背视频点播系统。这些系统的OEM制造商要求为其平台提供MPEG可交付内容，并要求提供特定的多路复用传输流文件。快进到今天，仍然需要对这些遗留系统的支持，但技术正在发展。感谢MPEG团队的辛勤工作和贡献。
首先，我认为我现在不会有职业生涯。

“2015年10月，卢卡和我是同一家公司的同事，我们决定吃素一个月，”冈森豪斯在被问及创业之初时说。“在开始我们的素食挑战后，我们不得不扫描食品标签，寻找隐藏的动物产品。就在那时，我们意识到超市里有多少产品含有不必要的糖和不健康的成分。出于好奇，我们检查了婴儿食品柜台，天真地认为它们会是最干净、最健康的食品。我们大错特错了。“。
Gunzenhauser和Michas观察到，婴儿食品通常含有添加的糖和盐、人造维生素，以及“长得可怕的保质期，这看起来相当奇怪”。
“每个人都在谈论为成年人提供的新鲜、健康、可持续的食物，但世界仍然在喂养我们家庭中最年轻的成员，这些产品比吃它们的婴儿年龄更大。”有些事情非常不对劲，我们并不理解。“。
就在那时，冈森豪斯的老朋友、食品科学家阿马多-布兰科(Amado-Blanco)解释说，这些产品是热杀菌的，这一过程也会影响产品的维生素含量、颜色和味道。三人决定一定有更好的方法，山摩出生了。
“我们与许多年轻父母讨论了他们对目前超市产品的看法，他们是如何喂养孩子的，以及他们需要什么。”Gunzenhauser解释说：“我们看到了市场上的一个明显的缺口，并为自己设定了创造世界上最新鲜、最美味的婴儿果泥的目标。”
与传统的热杀菌不同，Yamo使用高压巴氏杀菌(HPP)，这种杀菌方法在几分钟内就能杀死细菌，并保留了食物的天然营养、味道、颜色和气味。Yamo的产品可以冷藏8到12周。该公司最近还推出了据称是欧洲第一款儿童非乳制品酸奶，使用燕麦奶。
